item.title: Torrey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Only the Dead stay seventeen forever." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "What we seek is some kind of compensation for what we put up with." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Torrey add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Whatever comes," she said, "cannot alter one thing. If I am a princess in rags and tatters, I can be a princess inside. It would be easy to be a princess if I were dressed in cloth of gold, but it is a great deal more of a triumph to be one all the time when no one knows it." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "She waited for the train to pass. Then she said, "I sometimes think that people’s hearts are like deep wells. Nobody knows what’s at the bottom. All you can do is imagine by what comes floating to the surface every once in a while." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "In terms of evolutionary history, it was only yesterday that men learned to walk around on two legs and get in trouble thinking complicated thoughts. So don't worry, you'll burn out." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Early to bed and early to rise," Mazer intoned, "makes a man stupid and blind in the eyes." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "I think that most of us, anyway, read these stories that we know are not "true" because we're hungry for another kind of truth: the mythic truth about human nature in general, the particular truth about those life-communities that define our own identity, and the most specific truth of all: our own self-story. Fiction, because it is not about someone who lived in the real world, always has the possibility of being about oneself. --From the Introduction" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Because never in my entire childhood did I feel like a child. I felt like a person all along―the same person that I am today." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He who opens a school door, closes a prison." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "So long as there shall exist, by reason of law and custom, a social condemnation which, in the midst of civilization, artificially creates a hell on earth, and complicates with human fatality a destiny that is divine; so long as the three problems of the century - the degradation of man by the exploitation of his labour, the ruin of women by starvation and the atrophy of childhood by physical and spiritual night are not solved; so long as, in certain regions, social asphyxia shall be possible; in other words and from a still broader point of view, so long as ignorance and misery remain on earth, there should be a need for books such as this." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Reason is intelligence taking exercise. Imagination is intelligence with an erection." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Death may beget life, but oppression can beget nothing other than itself." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "All language is but a poor translation." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Torrey add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Every relationship is fundamentally a power struggle, and the individual in power is whoever likes the other person less." -- Chuck Klosterman
